Title: COSME ROSELL,
Data:
Republic of the Philippines
SUPREME COURT
Manila


SECOND DIVISION


A.M. No. 1354	October 24, 1983


COSME ROSELL, 
complainant,

vs.


JOSE E. FANTONIAL, 
respondent.


Valentino Legaspi for complainant. 


Jose T. Fantonial in his own behalf. 


R E S O L U T I O N 


Â 


AQUINO, 
J.:


Cosme Rosell on August 14, 1974 filed against his son-in-law, lawyer Jose E. Fantonial (admitted to the bar in 1955), a verified complaint for disbarment for conduct unbecoming a member of the bar. 


Fantonial and his wife, Marcosa Rosell answered the complaint. The case was referred to the Solicitor General for investigation, report and recommendation. 


In his report of April 16, 1983, the Solicitor General recommended the, dismissal of the complaint. Rosell died on May 8, 1975. He was substituted by his surviving spouse, Fausta Yuson, and three of his six children named Lorenzo, Wilfredo and Rosario, all surnamed Rosell.


Respondent Fantonial died on May 5, 1983. In view of his death, this case is considered closed and terminated. (
Action personalis moratur cum persona.)


SO ORDERED


Makasiar, Guerrero, Abad Santos and Escolin JJ., concur. 


Concepcion Jr. and De Castro are on leave.
